page.title: 13HANDBELL RINGERS
page.content: St. Stephen-on-the-Cliffs church has a very active team of handbell ringers. Many of the ringers have been girls from our school, and the present leader is an old girl. At first, when the parish had only a hall and no money for a church, some of the congregation bought the handbells and the choir went round the local hotels and public houses, playing tunes on the bells to raise money. In the early days of the ringers, they began on Christmas Day lunchtime at Uncle Tom's Cabin (mentioned on another of our pages.)Later on , the vicar and the curate took along the Youth Club too, and money was collected for missionaries. The handbell ringers always play in church on Christmas Eve, just before Midnight Mass.
